info.title: TruckMate REST API
info.description:
The TruckMate REST APIs are a comprehensive set of RESTful services, allowing you to seamlessly integrate with major TruckMate product areas. The TruckMate REST APIs allow developers to integrate the TruckMate product with custom or 3rd party applications, automate tasks, and much more.

Business use cases of the TruckMate REST APIs include:


- Internal systems: Use the APIs to share data and streamline internal business processes.
- External data sharing: In addition to internal networking, the APIs allow sharing TruckMate data with third party systems to connect and share information.
- App integrations: Access TruckMate data in real time.
- Embedded content: Request data from the TruckMate REST APIs to embed pieces of content onto your corporate site.

The endpoints and methods available are dependent on the license keys and authorization methods used. Use the following documentation to determine how to interact with the various available components.

[Download latest released OpenAPI](https://truckmatecloudhub.dev.trimble-transportation.com/tm/openapi.json "download")


 This documentation is based on the most currently released version of TruckMate. Documentation for previous versions can be accessed by navigating to the openapi.json endpoint for any given API (the service must be set up and running). For example: http://DOMAIN/openapi.json

---

tags.name: Appointments
tags.description: The Appointments API allows e-commerce partners to select a delivery appointment for orders not yet created in TruckMate. The list of available appointment windows can be constrained to be not earlier than the Earliest Delivery Date provided by TruckMate's Transit Time API, to ensure that delivery appointments are feasible according to service standards.

tags.name: Cloud Events
tags.description: Cloud Events allow submitting event data in common formats to provide interoperability across services.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description:
The Documents API allows for public viewing of specific imaging documents through a URL linked with a time sensitive token.
Synergize by Microdea is currently the only Document Management System supported by the TruckMate Documents API. The Synergize SOAP API is used to retrieve documents from the configured repository.
Imaging document types are configured in the Imaging section of the TruckMate Codes Maintenance program (CODES.EXE). To enable a configured document type to be viewable via the API ART.EXE must be set as a Accessible Program.

tags.name: Login
tags.description: The login authentication endpoints are used to generate a JWT (JSON Web Token) to be used as the authorization bearer token for subsequent API calls. Web users and their login credentials are configured either through the Profiles > TruckMate Customer and Vendor Profiles application  > TM4Web Configuration tab. TM4Web Access Group configuration options are setup in the TruckMate for Web > Web Admin application.

tags.name: Order Customs
tags.description: The TruckMate Order Customs API allows access to retrieve, create and update TruckMate Order Customs information. Customs Information for an order can be viewed in the TruckMate Customer Service application > Customs tab.

tags.name: Orders
tags.description:
The TruckMate Orders API allows access to TruckMate orders, rate quotes and pickup requests.

Orders refers to the freight bills created and managed by TruckMate for dispatch operations, billing, collections, and the General Ledger. Orders contain details about pickup, delivery, routing, load details, dangerous goods information, status history, trace numbers, rates, charges, extra charges, quotes, and more. 

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the TruckMate Customer Service application where you can enter and manage additional information about costs and expenses related to the freight bill. These include interliner charges, COD on freight, and freight bill based driver pay.

Pickup requests are viewed in the TruckMate Order Preprocessor application.

Child resources of the orders, rate quotes and pickup requests are found on their individual tabs within the associated Windows applications.

The endpoints, methods and features available are dependent on the authorization methods used.

tags.name: Reports
tags.description:
The TruckMate Reports API allows for retrieval and generation of Crystal and Zebra reports that are configured in TruckMate. Report parameters can be included when the API is used for report generation.

Reports are encoded in base64 and can be converted to text formats such as PDF using a valid converter tool. Reports are configured and can be generated using the TruckMate Crystal Report Launcher application.

tags.name: Transit Times
tags.description: Retrieves transit times using TruckMate's Service Level Matrix to calculate estimated delivery dates given pickup and delivery locations, service level(s) and pickup date(s).

tags.name: Trips
tags.description:
The TruckMate Trips API allows access to TruckMate trips. Trips can have resources assigned such as orders, carriers, drivers, power units and trailers. LTL and single leg based trips can be created using the TruckMate Trips API.

Trips can be viewed in the TruckMate Dispatch and Multi-Mode Dispatch applications where further additional dispatch related operations can be performed such as trip optimization, parking trips at doors and more.

The endpoints, methods and features available are dependent on the authorization methods used.

tags.name: Version
tags.description: The version endpoint allows the ART server version information to be retrieved. This will include the version number of the TruckMate ART Server (Windows Service) application.

tags.name: Web Address Book
tags.description: Retrieves, creates and updates TM4Web address book entries. TM4WEB address book entries can be viewed in the TruckMate Web Administration program > Client Features > Contacts tab > Address Book sub-tab. The TM4Web address book allows customers to provide contact addresses to their web users which may not yet be clients configured within TruckMate's Customer Profile application. These non-existent contacts should be reviewed in the Order Preprocessor program at which time the employee can decide if the contact already exists in Customer Profiles and change it to this, or if this is a new contact and needs to be added.

tags.name: Web Users
tags.description: Retrieves, creates and updates TM4Web users. TM4Web users can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Customer & Vendor Profiles program on the TM4Web Configuration tab. TM4Web users can log into the TM4Web application (TruckMate's web-based, self-service portal). TM4Web credentials can also be used with API calls to retrieve orders based on some of their associated Web Administration configuration options through the TruckMate REST API > GET Orders endpoint.

tags.name: Whoami
tags.description: Retrieves identity of the user associated with the provided authorization method.

get.description: Retrieves an array of pre-booked appointments providing visibility to appointments made. The filter query parameter allows searching for specific appointments (e.g., by customer and/or external identifier). Use the optional limit and offset query parameters to page through the resulting sets of data.

post.description: Creates a single new pre-booked appointment. Use the external identifier and source fields to uniquely identify the external system that is maintaining this appointment. A valid TruckMate customer who is placing this appointment is required. The appointment type, either pickup or delivery, is also required.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties of the new appointment to be created.

get.description: Retrieves a pre-booked appointment as specified by the appointment identifier in the target path parameter.

put.description: Updates a pre-booked appointment as specified by the appointment identifier in the target path parameter. Can be used for partial updates as only the properties sent in the request will be updated. Will return a 409 Conflict response if the appointment has already been matched to an order.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties to be updated. All fields are optional, but at least one field must be sent.

post.description:
Cloud Events allow submitting event data in common formats to provide interoperability across services.

The type attribute describes the type of event related to the originating occurrence.

There are currently 9 supported types:

 **noMatchingCarriers**

Before the tendering has even commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted when the Routing Guide in TTC fails to match any carriers to the route per the IP record's Start to End zone. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **noEligibleCarriers**

Before the tendering has even commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted when no eligible carriers have been found per the carriers provided by the Routing Guide. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **noRatedCarriers**

Before the tendering has even commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted when no rates could be calculated per the list of eligible carriers. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **exceptionOccurred**

Before or once the tendering has commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted only when a miscellaneous exception has occurred for any reason. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **sendEDI**

Instruct the TMS to send an EDI 204 to the carrier.

 **sendEDICancellation**

Instruct the TMS to send an EDI Cancellation to the carrier due to timeout or user cancellation in TTC.

 **created**

Used for informational purposes only, to indicate that the tender has been created in TTC. Expected to contain an array of 1 or more carriers. The first carrier to tender will have a status of 'IN_PROGRESS'. All other carriers will have a status of 'PENDING'.

 **updated**

Used for informational purposes only, to indicate that the tender has been updated in TTC. Expected to contain an array of 1 or more carriers. One carrier is expected to have a status of 'IN_PROGRESS'. All other carriers will have a status of either 'PENDING', 'REJECTED' or 'EXPIRED'.

 **completed**

Indicates that the Waterfall Tender is complete with either one or none of the carriers accepting ('ACCEPT') the load or user has canceled in TTC with a status of 'REJECTED', 'EXPIRED', 'TERMINATED' or 'CANCELED'.

get.summary: Retrieve a document from the image system
get.description:
Retrieves a document from the imaging server.
The document type and document identifier path parameters are used along with the token provided in the query string to determine access to the document.
Documents will be converted and returned in the specified document format (only PDF is supported at this time).

parameters.name: documentFormat
parameters.description: Format in which to return document (only PDF is supported currently)

post.description:
Generates a time sensitive token to be used in subsequent calls to retrieve the specific document from the imaging system.
The document type, as configured in the imaging system, and a document identifier, such as bill number, are required path parameters.
TruckMate API Credentials are required to generate the access token. The user configured in the TruckMate ART Server Administrator to run the TruckMate API Service provides the profile that determines which imaging documents can be accessed for generating the access token.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the length of time the token should be valid. Default expiry is one week, if no payload is provided.

get.description: Retrieves a new JWT (JSON Web Token) with a updated expiry time based on the supplied JWT authorization.

post.description: Generates and returns a JWT based on the supplied login credentials. The JWT can then be used as the authorization bearer token with subsequent API calls.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the username and password of a TM4Web user.

get.description:
Retrieves order customs records.

Customs information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

post.description:
Creates one or more customs information records for orders.

Customs information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab.

get.description:
Retrieve a specific order customs record.

Customs information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

put.description:
Updates one or more properties for the specified order customs record.

Customs information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab.

requestBody.description: The $select system query option allows clients to requests a specific set of properties for each entity or complex type.

delete.description:
Deletes the specified order customs record.

Customs information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab.

get.description:
Retrieves an order customs ACE record.

Customs ACE information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab > ACE and ACE In-Bond tabs.

Retrieves an order customs ACI record.

Customs ACI information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab > ACI tab.

Retrieves an order customs broker record.

Customs broker information for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab.

Retrieves an order customs user fields record.

Customs user fields for an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Customs tab > User Fields tab.

get.summary: Retrieve orders, pickup requests or rate quotes
get.description:
Retrieves order, pickup request, or rate quote records.

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the Customer Service application.

The ratingTerms field will only return a value if the following app config option is enabled.

   - RATES.EXE > Terms Rate Precedence

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

parameters.name: traceType
parameters.description: Trace type to search by. Required when using search functionality.

parameters.name: traceNumber
parameters.description: Trace number to search for. Required when using search functionality.

post.summary: Create a new order, pickup request or rate quote
post.description:
Creates one or more order, pickup request or rate quote records.

The following fields will be defaulted based on the following app config options:

* CSERV.EXE > Default Bill To

* CSERV.EXE > Default Site

 Other configuration options can affect how certain field values are populated if not provided in the request:

* startZone - defaults to the provided shipper zone or the shipper's default zone

* endZone - defaults to the provided consignee zone

* serviceLevel - defaults to Codes Maintenance > Site Setup > Service Level default

The billToCode can only be updated using the billTo override (R) option.

The interliner (I) option for billTo can only be used if there is at least one interliner record with that has a receivable chargesType option set.

Duplicate PO is not allowed on traceNumber for the same billTo when the app config option CSERV.EXE > Check PO is set.

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the  Customer Service application.

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

requestBody.description: The $select system query option allows clients to requests a specific set of properties for each entity or complex type.

parameters.name: copyOrderId
parameters.description: Create a new order or rate quote from an existing order or rate quote

get.summary: Retrieve an order, pickup request, or rate quote
get.description:
Retrieves a specific order, pickup request, or rate quote record.

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the Customer Service application.

The ratingTerms field will only return a value if the following app config option is enabled.

   - RATES.EXE > Terms Rate Precedence

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

put.summary: Update an order, pickup request or rate quote
put.description:
Updates one or more properties of the specified order, pickup request or rate quote record.

Only active orders, or pickup requests associated with the authentication key used to access the endpoint can be updated.

* Approved pickup requests cannot be updated.

* Orders must be posted (have a bill number) and cannot be cancelled or interfaced to billing.

Not all of the Security Configuration > Security > Business Events settings for Customer Service which allow or prevent editing of orders based on tab, status and other options are used by the APIs.

The requested body may include child resources such as details, dangerousGoods, customDefs, etc. Keep in mind when a resource is specified in the body, it will do a complete replace of that resource. In other words, it will DELETE ALL records of the specified resource in the order, and insert new ones from the request body.

To update an individual child record use the PUT method directly against the child resource record itself.

* For example, to update an individual detail line use PUT /orders/{orderId}/details/{orderDetailId}

Note that the API cannot edit or delete a Cash-On-Delivery (COD) record for an order but it can update the codAmount. If no COD record exists for the order, the API will create it.

The estimatedDeliveryDate will be updated based on the following app config option:

* CSERVE.EXE > Reset Estimated Delivery Date Value When Delivery Date of Freight Bill Changed

The billToCode can only be updated using the billTo override (R) option.

The interliner (I) option for billTo can only be used if there is at least one interliner record with that has a receivable chargesType option set.

Duplicate PO is not allowed on traceNumber for the same billTo when the app config option CSERV.EXE > Check PO is set.

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the Customer Service application.

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

COD records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > COD tab.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties to be updated. All fields are optional, but at least one field must be sent.

get.description:
Retrieves accessorial charge records for the specified order.

Accessorial charge records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Acc Chgs tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

post.description:
Adds one or more accessorial charge records for the specified order.

Accessorial charge records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Acc Chgs tab.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the accessorial charge records to add to the order.
